title: Get precise, context-specific answers from RAG index
description: AS A user I WANT TO get precise, context-specific answers to questions in the RAG index SO THAT I can make informed decisions.

title: Return answer with source document IDs for a valid question
description:
Scenario: User submits a question and receives an answer with source documents
  Given documents have been indexed in the vector store
  When the user submits a question to POST /query
  Then the response contains an "answer" field with generated text
  And the response contains a "sources" array with document IDs used by the answer

title: Control number of retrieved chunks with top_k parameter
description:
Scenario: User controls how many chunks are retrieved
  Given documents have been indexed in the vector store
  When the user submits a question with top_k set to 3
  Then at most 3 chunks are used for generating the answer

title: Filter retrieved documents by metadata
description:
Scenario: User filters documents by metadata
  Given documents with different authors have been indexed
  When the user submits a question with filters for author "Jane Doe"
  Then only chunks from documents by "Jane Doe" are used by the answer

title: Return appropriate response when no relevant documents found
description:
Scenario: User asks a question with no matching documents
  Given documents about cooking have been indexed
  When the user submits a question about quantum physics
  Then the response indicates no relevant information was found
  And the sources array is empty
